Key Match Events: Luiz Henrique and Igor Jesus scored the goals that rescued Brazil from another embarrassment in a 2-1 victory at Chile in South American qualifying for the 2026 World Cup.
Pre-Game Insights: President Lula thinks that the national team should feature only players from the big European leagues for major competitions.
Coach Dorival Júnior is expected to give more playing time to local players such as Igor Jesus and Luiz Henrique.
Gerson from Flamengo might replace the suspended Lucas Paquetá.
Vanderson and André might be in the starting 11 for Brazil against Peru.
Post-Match Reflections: Coach Dorival Júnior has called on 20 local-based players since taking over Brazil.
Argentina is under a little pressure when it welcomes Bolivia in Buenos Aires on Tuesday.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bolivia has won three consecutive matches in qualifying against Venezuela, Chile, and Colombia.
Uruguay coach Marcelo Bielsa is under pressure after a 1-0 defeat at Peru last Friday.
Others: Brazil rose to fourth on the table on 13 points, behind Lionel Messi's Argentina (19), Colombia (16), and Uruguay (15).
Bolivia has risen to fifth place, inside the top six positions that directly qualify for the World Cup.
